newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Sampoerna surges in late trading.
newsitem.headline: Sampoerna surges in late trading.

text.p: Indonesia's largest cigarette maker PT Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna surged in late trading on Monday following a weekend announcement that it had cancelled a shareholders meeting, brokers said.
It had risen 1,450 rupiah to 20,350 rupiah on a volume of 1.1 million shares at 0830 GMT.

"It had attracted bargain-hunters since morning but a large number of buyers appeared in late trade. It is fuelled by the announcement that it has cancelled its November 2 shareholders meeting," said one foreign broker.
Sampoerna said on Saturday it had cancelled the meeting because it would "not pursue a course of action which would necessitate the convening of this meeting".
Brokers said many investors believed the company was to have put forward proposals to increase its holding in automobile manufacturer Astra International at the meeting.
The market has not reacted well to Sampoerna's announcement last month that a subsidiary had bought a 2.85 percent stake in Astra and talk that it could look to increase its holding.
Brokers said the cancellation of the meeting signalled that Sampoerna was dropping any such plan for now.
